questions.text: The new high-speed train is the fastest one ever (1) ____ built.
questions.explanation: Correct form: 'been built'. The passive perfect form is needed.

questions.text: Travelling at over 600 km/h, it (2) ____ faster than most airplanes.
questions.explanation: Present simple 'is' is used to describe a fact.

questions.text: Its success is due to the use of magnetic levitation, which (3) ____ it to float above the tracks.
questions.explanation: 'Allows it to float' correctly shows the function of magnetic levitation.

questions.text: This technology reduces friction, making the journey smoother and more (4) ____ for passengers.
questions.explanation: 'Comfortable' is the correct adjective describing passenger experience.

questions.text: The trains are also designed with comfort in mind: seats are spacious and (5) ____ adjustable for long journeys.
Onboard services include Wi-Fi and a variety of food (6) ____.
questions.explanation: 'Food options' correctly refers to the available meals.

questions.text: It is remarkable how engineers managed to combine speed, safety, and (7) ____ in a single design.
questions.explanation: 'Efficiency' fits the context of technical and operational design.

questions.text: Many passengers agree that taking this train is not only (8) ____ but also an unforgettable experience.
questions.explanation: 'Exciting' matches the feeling described by passengers.
